page.title: 13ANHYDRITE MINE
page.content: The disused {anhydrite mine}under {Saltholme Farm}and the Billingham area was the centre of a campaign which gained publicity locally,nationally and internationally. In{Oct.1983}Britain's Nuclear Waste authority{NIREX}stated its intent to dump thousands of tons of {Nuclear {Waste}in the{anhydrite mine.}Twenty lorry loads a week was the first estimate,but this quickly rose to 40 increasing to{160}by the year 2000. At the first public meeting 843 people rejected{NIREX}proposal and the nucleus of{BAND}(Billingham Against Nuclear Dumping) was formed.A petition began and in less than six months 83,000 signatures were collected and delivered to the{P.M.}
